name: Kali Linux
description: Kali Linux is a Debian-based distribution developed by Offensive Security, designed for penetration testing and ethical hacking. It is one of the most recognized Linux distros in cybersecurity.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Kali Linux was released in 2013 as the successor to BackTrack, consolidating and improving a wide array of security tools under a new architecture.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Kali became the go-to OS for penetration testing, featuring over 600 tools, frequent updates, and a rolling-release model to ensure testers have the latest software.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Kali Linux is used worldwide by cybersecurity professionals and students. It supports live booting, secure environments, and multiple desktop environments.

sections.title: Penetration Testing Arsenal
sections.text: Kali is tailored for ethical hackers, with tools for network analysis, reverse engineering, wireless attacks, digital forensics, and more.
